Through time and space, I have observed you, Doctor. Your mind surpasses that of all other creatures.
What do you want?
You! Your mind will be invaluable to me. Therefore I have invented a machine that will drain all past knowledge and experience from your mind.
But you'll kill him!
Oh no, he will survive, his mind unharmed. Only empty as a newborn child's.
And if I refuse?
Then I shall have to seek the help of lesser mortals, like your companions here. And many, many others.
But you can't!
I can and I will.
Yes, I believe you.
You can't. We'll fight!
That will not do. The Doctor must submit willingly.
And if I do submit, what of the others?
Then the others will go free.
And my father too?
And him too. I'm only using this body to communicate with you.
He didn't help you before, then.
Oh, no. I have many other human hands at my command.
And who are they?
Always questioning! Even now, you're seeking to destroy me. I see I shall have to guide your thoughts.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Travers pulls Victoria towards him.

Dialogue.Line: No, Jamie, no.
Cooperate and the child will be unharmed. You have twenty minutes to make up your mind.
Let me go, Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Travers and the Yeti leave, with Victoria.

Dialogue.Line: Jamie, don't be a fool. You don't stand a chance.
Let me go! Victoria! Let me past, Colonel.
No, the Doctor's right. There've been enough lives wasted.
And what are we going to do? Just sit around and wait for the next thing to happen?
Don't be a fool, boy! We can't fight those things bare-handed. We must work out a plan!
Well you do what you want, I'm going.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But there is a Yeti right outside the door.

Dialogue.Line: He left one of those things there to stop us getting away. Now, Victoria is quite safe.
Safe?
The Intelligence knows that if it harms her, I won't cooperate.
Does that go for my father too?
Yes, Anne, it does.
Oh, are you sure?
Yes, I'm sure!
Permission to speak, sir.
Yes, what is it, Evans?
Well, stop me if I've got it wrong, sir, but if this Intelligence thing here gets the Doctor, will he leave us all alone?
Yes, that's what it looks like. What's in your mind?
Well, sir, why don't we just let it have him? Then we could all go home.
Please, my wrist. Professor! Professor, please. You're hurting me. My wrist! Professor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Travers pulls Victoria on towards the beep signal.

Dialogue.Line: Will this Intelligence keep its word, do you think?
Well, it didn't in Tibet.
Jamie.
Leastways, it's a chance.
But it's not you that's taking the risk, is it?
I reckon he ought to give himself up now.
Evans, when I want your opinion I'll ask for it.
Sorry, sir.
It's all right, Evans. If I don't come up with the answer, I will give myself up, I promise.
That's okay then.
You will not give yourself up.
Don't be foolish, Jamie!
But Victoria!
She will be your responsibility. And when it's all over, you'll just both have to look after me, that's all.
Ay?
Well, if what the Intelligence says is true, my mind will be like that of a child. You'll have to look after me until I grow up.
Oh.
Don't worry. I'm going to try not to let it happen.
Hey, wait a minute.
What is it, Evans? What's the matter now?
Stand back everyone.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Evans opens the door. The Yeti has gone.

Dialogue.Line: I thought I heard it go!
Yes, well, we'd better make sure. Evans, you, myself and McCrimmon will go and search the place. Doctor, you'd better stay behind here and get on with your tinkering.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Colonel, Jamie and Evans leave.

Dialogue.Line: You're not seriously thinking of giving yourself up to those creatures, are you?
I sincerely hope it won't come to that, Anne.
It's so hopeless. What can we do?
This control box. We've got to get it working!
Doctor, we've only got twenty minutes.
Then there's no time to lose, is there? Oh, come on, Anne, don't give up. I need your help.
Yes, of course.
Right. Now hand me that sphere, will you?
I suppose that Yeti was left there as a kind of rear guard.
Possibly.
If we went into the tunnels, we'd run into them again.
Yes, probably would.
But supposing we were to go over the top? You see, Colonel, as I see it, there's only one way for them to go. South.
Yes?
So if we could get ahead of them.
What, take them by surprise, you mean?
Aye.
What's the point? You can't fight those things. I know, I've tried.
Anyway, we'd never get back in, sir. All the stations are locked.
We might find one that's open. I mean, after all, the Yeti get in and out. Why can't we?
Well, I reckon we're safer here, sir.
Aye, we are. But what about Victoria and Travers, eh? Och, if you're both too scared, I'll go myself.
Wait a minute, McCrimmon. I think it's pointless, but at least we'll be doing something active.
What about the Doctor and Miss Travers, sir?
Oh, yes. Mustn't leave them unprotected. You stay here, Evans.
Right, sir.
And don't go taking any chances.
Don't worry. I won't.
And the cross wires here.
I still don't see how you can
Well, I haven't finished yet. Now if you detach the germanium crystal strip here, and then attach the collector and the emitter.
Yes, yes, and link up there. Of course. Then the frequency variations, they'll automatically change!
Simple?
Yes.
Right. You get on with that.
Okay.
And I'll just check this sphere. Yes. Yes, that should complete the circuit. Good. I wonder?
There's only one way to find out.
Yes. Certainly no sound out there.
Shall we chance it, then?
Why not. Now!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie flings open the door, but there is a mass of fungus behind it.

Dialogue.Line: No! Back! No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They try to push the door closed again as the fungus makes it way inside.

Dialogue.Line: Push! Push! Push, hard as you can! Push, get your back to it! Get your back to it! Fire door by the stairs. Go and unhitch it. I'll try to hold this. Go on, McCrimmon!
You sure?
Yes, go on! Go on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie runs back to the fire door as the fungus forces the main door further open.

Dialogue.Line: All right, Colonel, come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lethbridge-Stewart retreats and the fungus floods inside the Fortress entrance.

Dialogue.Line: Strange, it's not picking up. The Intelligence must be transmitting. I wonder why it's not working.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor thumps the bench and the sphere starts beeping.

Dialogue.Line: Aha! Success! It's going, Anne.
Oh, oh that's marvellous.
Come along.
I'm sorry I'm being so long. This is such a fiddling job.
Help you in a minute.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor puts the sphere on the floor and it rolls to the door.

Dialogue.Line: There we are. Yes, you see, it's homing. There we are. Fairly strongly

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie and the Colonel enter.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor!
Careful. Shut the door.
What?
The sphere. The sphere, it's working.
Never mind about that.
Why, what's happened?
We tried to get out the surface door, but the fungus is there.
Well, I'm not surprised. I thought the Intelligence would try to hem us in.
Yes, unfortunately it's got into HQ.
What?
Don't worry. Managed to get a fire door closed. Should hold it.
I hope you're right.
Come on, Anne. We must get to work.
Doctor, tell me, this sphere of yours. Exactly how's it going to help us?
Well, the sphere itself, it won't.
Eh?
No. But it will help us to test the control box.
Is that all?
All?
You mean to say you've wasted all this time, just to
Wasted? We haven't been wasting our time.
Well, I think you have!
Must agree with the boy, Doctor. You don't seem to have achieved very much.
Colonel, if you left us alone we'd get along a lot quicker.
Oh, very well. Come on, McCrimmon. We'll leave them to it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Colonel and Jamie leave.

Dialogue.Line: Right, Anne. Let's get on with this control box.
Right, let's have a look at this board.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Evans appears from behind the door, rifle in hand.

Dialogue.Line: Evans, what exactly do you think you're playing at?
Been working it out, I have, see. Come to the conclusion one of you two must be working for this Intelligence.
Oh, for heaven's sake.
No. It told us it had another pair of hands working for it. Well, I know it's not me, see, so it must be one of you two. Stands to reason, don't it.
Oh, don't be daft, man. It's Chorley. I've said so all along.
Well, it's only natural you'd say that, ain't it?
I don't know what you're talking about, Evans, and quite frankly I don't care. Now McCrimmon and I are going out into the tunnels. You'd better join the Doctor and Miss Travers.
If it's all the same to you, sir, I'd prefer to stay here.
Evans, I gave you an order.
A better position here, sir. Keep an eye on the corridors, I can. Better tactically, don't you think, sir?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Travers is holding Victoria.

Dialogue.Line: Please Professor, let me go. I won't try to escape. Oh, please.
Release her, Professor. As she says, she will not escape. There is nothing for you to be afraid of, child.
Isn't there? Where are you?
Nearby.
Why don't you show yourself?
All in good time. Travers, you have served your purpose. Awake.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Travers collapses.

Dialogue.Line: Soon you will both see me.
What's happened? Where are we?
I think you'd better rest for a bit.
Rest? No. Work to do. I've got to help the Doctor. Don't run, Victoria, but there's a Yeti over there, on the platform.
I know.
Yes, well, we'll try and give it the slip. What did you say?
I know. That's the one that brought us here.
What? Well, come on, Victoria

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Travers and Victoria back away along the platform, but a second Yeti blocks their escape. Victoria screams.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor. Doctor, do hurry.
Nearly ready. There. Now then, let's see if it works.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The sphere does nothing as the Doctor uses the control box.

Dialogue.Line: Is it at full power?
Yes.
Then we've failed.
Hang on a minute

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor moves closer to the sphere. It stops bleeping.

Dialogue.Line: Ah ha!
Oh, it works.
Back you come. Yes, the trouble is, it only works at very short range.
But still, that's better than nothing. So now what do we do?
Well, we know that your control box can stop a Yeti. Now then, if I can re-programme this sphere to obey our verbal commands.
Yes, but can we do it? I mean, in the time?
How long have we got?
Twelve minutes.
Do we go on or turn back?
Let's go on.
Right. Come on. What are you waiting for?
What made you choose this turning, Colonel?
What? Well, I don't know really. Why? You're not still thinking about what Evans said, are you?
Well, he was right about one thing. One of us is working with the Intelligence.
I can assure you it's not me, McCrimmon.
Aye, maybe so.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie spots something on the rails.

Dialogue.Line: Hey, wait a minute!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It's a handkerchief.

Dialogue.Line: This is Victoria's. We're on the right track.
Anne's all right, you say?
Don't worry, Professor. The Doctor's bound to come up with something.
I wish I shared your confidence, m'dear. Hello, what's happening?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Staff Sergeant Arnold comes out of the tunnel.

Dialogue.Line: Arnold! How'd you get here? I thought Victoria said
What, what's happened, sir?
Shush! Give me a moment. Do you think you can get to HQ?
I'll try, sir.
Yeah, well, get hold of the Doctor and tell him where we are.
Right, sir.
Thank you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Arnold goes back into the tunnel. The Yeti have noticed nothing.

Dialogue.Line: Can't we go with him?
No, Victoria. That Yeti's guarding us. If we go, it'll follow. I don't think they've found out about Arnold yet.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Evans is lounging in a chair when he hears a beeping noise. The sphere rolls into the room and Evans picks his feet up off the floor, then as it gets closer he stands on the chair and makes to shoot it.

Dialogue.Line: No, don't shoot!
Is that thing on our side, then?
It is now. Stop.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The sphere stops bleeping.

Dialogue.Line: Were you scared?
Eh? Oh no, no, I mean, I just got up here to get a better aim, that's all. How did you make it stop then?
Simple, I told it to.
Here, ball. Why don't you go back where you come from?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The sphere stays still.

Dialogue.Line: Now pull the other one.
Oh, show him, Doctor.
All right, I will. Move forward. Stop. Move to the left. Stop. There you are, how about that?
Hey, that's great! Make a smashing toy, that would.
Toy? That's a highly complex piece of equipment.
Oh, is it? Well I don't see how it's going to help us.
But it obeys our commands.
So?
Well, once we get it inside a Yeti, we'll have a powerful ally.
Inside a Yeti?
Yes, certainly. Will you help us?
You must be joking, Go near one of them things? I may be stupid, but I'm not daft.
Oh. Very well, Anne, I shall have to do it myself.
Oh, I'm coming with you, Doctor.
No, no, it's far too dangerous.
There you are, what'd I tell you?
Not another word. I'm coming with you.
Hold it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A figure is coming towards them.

Dialogue.Line: Staff Arnold? It can't be. We'd given you up for lost.
Easy, easy. That's it.
Sorry about this, sir.
What happened?

I don't know. Can't remember. I were pushing the trolley through the fungus, and I blacked out. I thought I were falling. When I come to, sir, I were in the tunnels. Where's the Doctor, sir? I met the Professor and the girl back there and
Victoria? Is she all right?
Yeti guarding them, but I promised I'd tell the Doctor, sir.
Right. Come on, back to HQ.
I'm going for Victoria.
We'd stand a better chance if we stick together. Go ahead. Come on, Staff. Take it easy.
Thank you, sir. Right, sir.
Careful.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Travers checks his watch.

Dialogue.Line: The Doctor's twenty minutes are almost up.
Professor?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There's a very fast beeping sound, and the Yeti move their captives along the platform.

Dialogue.Line: Where are they taking us?
Now keep calm, Victoria. I'm sure the Doctor will think of something.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The black line on the map is moving to Warren Street station. There are footsteps outside, so Evans hides.

Dialogue.Line: Now, that's it then.
Evans, come out from behind that board.
Oh, it's you, sir.
Where's the Doctor? Evans!
B-b-but y-y-you, you
Stop bleating like a Welsh baa-lamb, Evans, and answer the Colonel.
Sir?
Doctor and Miss Travers, where are they?
Gone, sir.
Gone where?
Warren Street, I think.
Why?
After a Yeti, they said.
Look at the board, sir. Warren Street.
Come on!
No, not you, Staff. Evans, make yourself useful. Get a dressing for the Staff Sergeant's head.
Sir.
Thank you, sir.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is gazing at the wall of fungus blocking their way.

Dialogue.Line: Do you think it's mutating, Anne?
I don't know, but I don't think we'll stay and find out, Doctor.
No, perhaps you're right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There is a Yeti behind them.

Dialogue.Line: We're trapped!
Give me the control box, Anne.
The control box.
Yes.
Haven't you got it, Doctor?
What? Hold the sphere!
Oh Doctor, you must have it!
Yes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor finds the box in his pocket and tries to use it.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor!
Don't worry, it'll work. It's got to work!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Yeti stops right in front of them.

Dialogue.Line: I know you said it only worked at short range, but for a moment
Don't tell me you were worried? Would you like to hold this for me? Now then. It's all right, it's quite safe.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor removes the Yeti's control sphere.

Dialogue.Line: Nearly out. There. Right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor puts their modified sphere into the Yeti.

Dialogue.Line: Now then. Turn round!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Yeti obeys.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, it works! You've done it.
We've done it, you mean. Now then, with my reprogrammed sphere and your control box, we should be able to work him over quite a distance. And put your arm down.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Yeti lowers it's arm.

Dialogue.Line: Now we've got a chance, Anne. Come on. Oh, mustn't forget him. Come on, Fred, at the double.
Hold still, can't you?
Oh, come on, Evans. Get on with it.
I reckon I ought to have been a doctor. Real professional, that is.
All right then, doctor. Take your gear back to the lab.
Oh, right-ho then.
And when you've done that, you can come back and shift that chair.
Staff! Staff!
What is it?
What are we going to do now, Staff?
The main door should keep the fungus out of the tunnels for a bit. We must warn the others that HQ's had it.
Right.
Well, come on, then.
Oh, oh no, not me.
You're not disobeying an order, are you, Evans?
Now look here, Staff. If we go up there, and this stuff breaks out, we'll be trapped.
Now look, lad, you're scared, that's understandable. But you've been in the Army long enough to know that orders is orders. There's four people up there. If we don't warn them, they're for the chop.
So? Four of them's getting the chop. There's no reason to make it six, is there?
I've had enough of your lip for one day. Come on. Follow me. Evans! Come back here!
Not on your nellie! Cheerio, Staff!
Right, then. I'll get you for this!
Anne.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Yeti walks past.

Dialogue.Line: Hey!
Stop. Come back here. Stop. Anne, I've been thinking. Until we know who else is working for the Intelligence, everyone must be suspect.
Yes?
Well, the fewer people who know this chap's on our side, the better.
Yes. Yes, and whoever is the Intelligence is bound to know that you're controlling this Yeti.
I know. You are to remain here for, do you think a minute will be enough?
What for?
For us to get clear.
Perhaps.
You are to remain here for ninety seconds, and then resume acting on orders from the Intelligence until you are told otherwise. Is that understood?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Yeti roars.

Dialogue.Line: Right. Switch off for ninety seconds starting from now. Come on, Anne.
It is them. Come on. Am I glad to see you! There's fungus at Warren Street.
Yes, I know.
Oh. What are you doing down here, anyway?
Well, as a matter of fact. I'll tell you another time. Hello, Colonel.
Glad to see you're both safe. Any luck with your gadgets?
No. No, I'm afraid not.
Pity.
Any news of Victoria?
Yes, she's at the Piccadilly Station.
Piccadilly?
Is my father there too?
Aye, he's with her.
Are they all right?
Yes.
How do you know?
I ran across Arnold - he saw them.
Arnold?
Arnold? But Evans said the fungus
Yes, he went into it, all right, but he came out again somehow. Says he can't remember what happened.
We haven't got any time to find out.
No, time's nearly up.
Yes, your twenty minutes.
Yes.
Yes.
Well, come on then.
What are you going to do?
We can't do anything until we get back to Headquarters, and then, if we've got time, we'll try and increase the range of the control units.
Yes.
Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Back along the tunnel, the Doctor's Yeti starts beeping again. After a short while it is joined by two others, and they all move off.

Dialogue.Line: What is it, Colonel?
Something up ahead.
We can't go back.
What, fungus, you mean?
No.
Yes.
Yes.
Is that you, Colonel?
It's Arnold. Hang on, Staff!
Why isn't he in HQ?
Sir, the fungus, it's swamped HQ.
No!
I'm afraid so, sir. The main doors should keep it out of the tunnels for a bit, but
Where's Evans?
Scarpered, sir.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Three Yeti arrive and surround them.

Dialogue.Line: Our time's up! We're all together. They've come to fetch us!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Evans hears beeping and hides in an alcove. A Yeti walks past and he comes out, straight into a second one.

Dialogue.Line: Er, hello. If you're looking for your friend, he went that way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The first Yeti returns.

Dialogue.Line: Look, you don't want me. I'm not one of them, see? Driver, that's what I am. I shouldn't be down here at all, really. Hey, steady on. Oh, going for a walk, are we? There's lovely.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Yeti carry Evans away.
The Yeti make the group stop.

Dialogue.Line: I'm going to make a break for it, sir.
Think you can?
Well, it's worth a try. On the loose, sir, I might be able to do something. If only you could distract them, sir.
Right, Staff.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Yeti has got its instructions now.

Dialogue.Line: I think it wants us to go on, sir.
Right. Here we go.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Colonel stumbles against the Doctor, knocking him down.

Dialogue.Line: Wait! Can't you see he's fallen over?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Arnold makes his escape in the confusion.

Dialogue.Line: Where are we being taken, Professor?
Oh, to meet the Intelligence, I suppose.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A throne-like seat stands in front of the ticket office, linked to a -

Dialogue.Line: A pyramid!
Yes, but it's different! We've never seen one like this before. It's fascinating! This must be the machine that the Intelligence intends using on the Doctor.
Oh, no, no, no. I shouldn't if I was you.
Yes, I think perhaps you're right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There is someone in the shadows.

Dialogue.Line: There's someone there.
What?
There!
Who's there? Who is it?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The shadow leaves

Dialogue.Line: Did you see who it was?
No. Do you think it could have been
The Intelligence? If only we could do something.
I'm sure the Doctor will think of something.
No, not this time, Victoria. The Doctor would never risk the chance of the Intelligence harming you.
You mean he'll just give in?
Yes, I'm afraid so. Afraid there's no alternative.

Yes, you're right, Professor. He has no alternative. I am sorry not to be here to welcome you personally, but I am sure you will not be offended. After all, the guest of honour is the Doctor. He, I am sure, will cooperate as I advise you to do. Any attempt to interfere would be pointless. My Yeti can destroy you so easily.
It's all my fault. If I hadn't tampered with that sphere. People killed, London invaded, all because of my wretched curiosity.
Don't blame yourself, Professor.
Why not? I've sacrificed you all, and for what?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is playing the first two lines of 'Skye Boat Song' on his recorder, as the Yeti guard the group. The Colonel paces restlessly.

Dialogue.Line: Why didn't you tell me all this before?
Him.
You don't think the Colonel?
Well, you never know, do you?
Which one is ours?
I don't know.
What?
Well, unfortunately I've lost track of him.
Oh, that's a great help.
Well, never mind, I want you to take this microphone and keep on calling our Yeti to you.
How will I know I've got the right one?
You'll soon know if you haven't got the right one, won't you. Jamie, I hope you don't suffer from claustrophobia.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chorley is hiding in an alcove as Arnold goes past.

Dialogue.Line: Sergeant! Oh, thank heavens I found you. I've been wandering down here by myself for ages.
Well, well, well. Quite forgotten about you we had, Mister Chorley.

Tried to get out over the surface, but there are Yeti everywhere. And there's this fungus and fog, all around, you see, and it's hopeless! I tried to get back to HQ, I tried, but all the stations were locked, you see, and I couldn't get back in. And all the time I kept seeing more and more Yeti, and they were closing in on me. I was retreating. I was always retreating, and then, at last I found I could get into Piccadilly, but when I got down there, there was this machine and that Professor, and a girl. And more Yeti. They're everywhere!
My, my, my. We are in a state, aren't we, sir.
Yes. All right. So, I'm frightened. Well so would you be if you'd been up there.
It's all right, sir. Nothing to be ashamed of.
Yes.
There's just one thing that puzzles me though, sir.
Oh, what's that?
How you managed to exist all this time. Why didn't the Yetis get you?
Look, Sergeant, what are you suggesting? You're not suggesting that I
Oh no, sir, I was just wondering, that's all. I think perhaps you'd better come along with me, don't you, sir? Come on now.
Where's the control box?
Hmm?
The control box.
It's in my pocket.
Well, why don't you use it on these Yeti, and then maybe we can escape.
Oh, no. I must meet the Intelligence face to face.
Doctor?
What is it?
Been thinking. The Yeti haven't noticed McCrimmon's disappearance yet. Not that I think he'll be able to achieve anything.
Well, go on.
Well, I don't really know how to say this, but there's Miss Travers and Victoria to think of, and, er
You mean, am I going to give myself up?
Yes. Of course, the decision must be yours, yours alone. But the Intelligence did promise to release Travers and Victoria.
You believe that?
Well, why not?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Anne hears beeps.

Dialogue.Line: Hello, we've got company.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two Yeti come out of the tunnel carrying Evans, and put him down.

Dialogue.Line: Hello, sir.
Evans, where the devil have you been?
Didn't Staff Arnold tell you, sir?
Yes. Sounded very like desertion to me.
Desertion? Me? Oh, good heavens, no. No, I thought I'd try a single- handed and desperate attempt to rescue Professor Travers and the girl. Isn't Staff Arnold about?
No.
Good.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: One of the Yeti steps behind the Doctor.

Dialogue.Line: Listen.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It pushes him up the steps to the ticket hall.

Dialogue.Line: Now listen, everyone. When the Yeti come for you, don't struggle. Whatever you do, don't resist them.
Don't struggle, he says. He must be joking.
The Doctor will have to give in. There's no other choice.
Aye, aye, time to get fell in.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They are moved off along the platform by the Yeti. When all have gone, the lid of a sand bin is lifted and Jamie looks out.

A Yeti comes to meet the Doctor and his escort, holding a helmet-like device. It makes to put it on the Doctor's head, then both Yeti stop beeping. The control box has worked. The Doctor takes the device and examines it.

Dialogue.Line: Thank you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor makes some adjustments to the device and gives it back to the Yeti, then switches off the control box again. The Yeti puts the device on the Doctor's head.

Dialogue.Line: Father! Oh, Father, are you all right?
Yes, I'm all right. Don't worry, Anne.
Jamie and the Doctor, where are they?
Anne?
Yeti? Come towards me. I'm standing beside the platform at Piccadilly Station. Yeti, wherever you are, come towards me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Yeti comes out of the tunnel.

Dialogue.Line: Come towards me. Like that, that's it. Come to. Right now, raise your right arm. Raise your right arm!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But the Yeti carries on along the track and into the far tunnel.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, what's the use.
Well, there's nothing to be afraid of. Just be calm.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is brought in wearing the helmet device.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor!
The Doctor!
Doctor!
What are they going to do?
Now don't worry, Victoria.
Oh, but
Everything's under control. Don't be frightened.
But Doctor, what are they going to do?
Everything is under control. Tell her, Anne. You understand.
Yes, yes, I think so.
Now listen, everyone. Don't do anything foolish! I am perfectly all right.
Yes, he is perfectly all right. Thank you, Doctor, for being so cooperative.
Why don't you show yourself? Who are you?
Silence. You will know soon enough.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chorley enters with a Yeti.

Dialogue.Line: Chorley?
Chorley?
Good grief.
That horrible little man?
You, the Intelligence?
No.!
No, he can't be the Intelligence. He can't be. It doesn't make sense.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: CHORLEY, having recovered his breath, is flustered and close to tears. He turns and points down the passageway.

Dialogue.Line: It isn't me. It isn't me. Don't you understand? I'm not the Intelligence. The Intelligence is him!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Arnold comes out of the shadows.

Dialogue.Line: It can't be!
Oh, it's too horrible. I don't believe it!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Arnold's face is blank.

Dialogue.Line: Arnold.
(no accent) No, merely Arnold's lifeless body in which I have concealed myself. But let us to work. There will be time for discussion later. In fact, all the time in the world.
Oh, so you weren't going to let us go then afterwards.
Did you think he would?
The last member of the party. Come and join us.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Yeti brings Jamie in.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, Jamie!
Victoria, are you all right?
Yes.
Your solicitude is touching. Nevertheless, it is wasting time.
Frightened that something might go wrong?
Join the Doctor.
Do what he says, Jamie.
Take him!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Yeti grabs Jamie around the neck.

Dialogue.Line: I must ensure your complete cooperation, Doctor. Should you prove at all unhelpful, your young friend's neck will be broken.
You gave your word that no one would be harmed. I refuse to submit until you release Jamie!
All right. Release the boy. But at the first sign of trouble from you
Don't worry. I will do what you say.
Good. Into the machine, Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor steps into the pyramid.

Dialogue.Line: What's he going to do?
What's happening?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There is a chair under a mass of circuitry. The Doctor sits in it. Arnold makes some adjustments then lowers a metal circlet onto the helmet the Doctor is wearing.

Dialogue.Line: Soon your mind will be absorbed by the Great Intelligence. You should be very proud, Doctor. Your knowledge of the past will help to shape the future of this planet.
Just get on with it, please.
You seem very anxious suddenly.
I just want it over and done with.

Submission is essential. You must understand, Doctor, that without your complete cooperation this transference would be of no value. Should you offer any opposition, either physical or mental, I shall be forced to punish you, or rather your friends. Prepare for a great darkness to cloud your mind.
Attack now! Attack the Yeti!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The tame Yeti turns on the other Yeti.

Dialogue.Line: Get Arnold!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It attacks Arnold.

Dialogue.Line: No!
Get the Doctor out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor shakes off attempts to rescue him.

Dialogue.Line: No, you don't understand. You'll ruin everything! No!
Professor! Anne! Give us some help!
No! No! No! Leave me be! You don't understand. I've got to stay here!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Evans and the Colonel pull the Doctor out of the pyramid and Jamie throws the headset into it. BOOM! The Yeti all collapse.

Dialogue.Line: Well, that's that then, innit?
You blithering Welsh imbecile! Why can't you do what you're told!
Hey, now just a minute, Doctor. If we hadn't pulled you out of that, you'd have been a heap of dust by now.
You're just as bad. I told you to leave it to me! Now you've gone and ruined everything.
Ruined everything? How can we? We we've won, haven't we?
No!
What do you mean, Doctor?

Oh, why didn't they leave it to me? I had crossed those wires on that helmet thing. The Intelligence wouldn't have drained me, I would have drained the Intelligence! As it is, all we got was a crossed circuit.
You mean, all we've done is cut off its contact with Earth? It's still out there in space somewhere, flying around?
Precisely! Look.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Arnold lies dead, a charred husk.

Dialogue.Line: Oh!
Oh, poor fellow!
Do you mean to say that Arnold wasn't the Intelligence?
No. He was just a poor soldier that was taken over. He was probably one of the first to disappear.
You mean it might come back?
Well, it's still around, isn't it? I've failed.
Nonsense, man.
You were marvellous.
Yes. Great victory.
I doubt it.
No, you were a hero, and you know it.
You don't really think so, do you.
Yes, yes,. I do.
You've got to face facts, old man. By tomorrow morning you're going to be a household word, a national figure.
Oh, no. Oh, no.
Yes. I want you on my television programme, and
Oh, no!
and I want to organise a big press conference, and
Jamie! Victoria! Come along, it's time we left.
But the press conference, Doctor.
Goodbye!
But Doctor? Doctor, you can't go yet. There are a lot of things I want to discuss with you.
I'm sorry, Travers, we have to go.
Where are you going?
Covent Garden. Come along. Come along, Jamie. Goodbye, Travers.
Goodbye Victoria, dear. Goodbye. Goodbye.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Jamie and Victoria disappear down to the platform.

Dialogue.Line: Where's he going?
Oh, er, back to his Tardis, I suppose.
You mean this, uh, this time machine thing, it really exists?
Well, I, er. Oh, explain it to him, Anne, will you? Colonel, I think we'd better check up top, don't you?
Right, Professor. Evans!
Father? Father, I
Now don't you go, Miss Travers. I'd like you to explain all about this time machine for me.
Oh, dear.
Well, where do we go? Which is the way to Covent Garden?
Oh, don't ask me. I've completely lost my bearings.
All these tunnels look the same to me.
Come on, let's try this way.
Well, it doesn't matter, anyway. I mean, there's no danger, is there?
Well, not from the Yeti, no, but who knows, they might suddenly start the trains again! Come on!
Trains?
Oh!
Come on!
